title: Juventus expected to return for Man United outcast Jadon Sancho after failing to land him last summer - Man United News And Transfer News
body_text:
INEOS are desperate to back Ruben Amorim in the market, and Manchester United will likely move several high-profile stars on in the summer, including the likes of Jadon Sancho.
The Englishman spent the last season out on loan at Chelsea, managing five goals and 10 assists, and while the overall stats might not look too bad, his inconsistency was something that irked Enzo Maresca.
In 2025, the 25-year-old managed a solitary goal and one assist in the Premier League and despite his heroics in the Conference League final, the Blues have decided to send him back to Old Trafford.
The Stamford Bridge had an obligation to buy for £25 million should they finish in the top-14, and sure enough, the London side endued up securing Champions League football.
Jadon Sancho has many suitors
But they have opted to renege on their agreement and will pay a penalty of £5 million after failing to agree on new wages with the England international.
INEOS promptly offered him to West Ham, both directly and as part of a swap deal with Mohammed Kudus heading to the Theatre of Dreams. Graham Potter turned down both proposals.
There is interest from Saudi Pro League, but the ex-Manchester City academy ace is hellbent on staying in the Premier League with the likes of Newcastle, Brentford and Aston Villa interested.
But moving to either might need him to lower his wage demands, something the United star has no intention of doing, and now, as per Il Bianconero, Juventus have also joined the race.
They have been long-term admirers, and were among the teams chasing his signature last summer. Now, they do not want to pay as much but continue to monitor proceedings with interest. No amount is mentioned nor the formula of a deal.
“Jadon Sancho could once again have a summer on the market after last year. Chelsea will not exercise the option to buy, even paying a penalty of 6 million euros, and therefore the player will return to the Red Devils, and then relocate elsewhere, given that he is not part of Manchester United’s plans.
Juventus has joined the race
“According to Tuttosport, the English winger could return to the game for Juventus, who had tried to sign him at the end of August but failed.
“There is no negotiation going on at the moment and, the newspaper reports, it is not certain that he is still worth what he was worth a year ago (after all, the management at Continassa has also changed), but Sancho could become an idea capable of teasing many Champions League clubs, including Juve.
“Also because the contract expiring in 2026 favors a low-cost operation. He is clearly not a priority for the Bianconeri at the moment, who are dealing with very important issues, but his name will still be monitored.”
They are aware that Jadon Sancho has a contract with United till 2026 and the English giants will be desperate to move him on so a low-cost exit could be on the cards.
Whether Juve go all out to land him remains to be seen. It is likely that the versatile attacker will move to the side who offers him the largest wages or at least close to what he was earning at Old Trafford.
